comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content:
I'm not convinced the title has been transcribed accurately, I read it as "a sawterelle" which I assume is the machine that looks as if it is a cross between a crossbow and a grenade launcher.

Does anyone have accurate information to replace my speculations?

comment.author: 10771167@N00
comment._content: More speculation...Sauterelle is French for grasshopper.  The name is applied to a variety of man-made objects, in cluding woodworking tools, a boat,  a carnival attraction, etc.  Given the appearence of this thing, I can well imagine it being called a grasshopper.  It looks like it was designed to lob sandwiches from trench to trench.

comment.author: 77924145@N04
comment._content: French cross-bow grenade thrower "Arbalète sauterelle type A "d'Imphy" circa 1915.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: More about this weapon, including diagrams: www.maquetland.com/v2/index.php?page=vision&id=798&am...

comment._content: Thanks for info, we'll update the record.
